comment: finally at minute 23 professor Brennan says something serious about cholesterol who knows whether she forgot all strange ideas on climate.
Why not take more complicated examples like reduction of Sn+4 by Al? Or demonstrate why certain intermediate oxidation states tend to disprooertionate but certain others do not (e.g Cu+1vs Fe+2).
Absolutely well done and definitely keep it up!!! 👍👍👍👍👍
Freeze the video, click to 20:33  Image Caption: "Ta-Daaahhhh"
I can honestly say that I learn more watching these videos than I have with my current professor all semester. The concepts are well organized, introduced, and explained.

I've watched online chemistry videos from several different universities and there's no question MIT goes deeper.  As to the quality of the teaching, it's more like these professors are more intelligent and better-educated than their peers, BUT that does not necessarily translate in all respects to a better learning experience. No question they've got an iron grip on the material, though.
I'm a biochemistry student and this really helped me understand many concepts...

its time for us to move beyond lectures and move to online educational videos.   how many of those students are seriously going to understand this non-stop rush of information  Its sooooooooo much better to be able to pause... REWIND..... and watch again.  as long as the teacher does ONE VERY GOOD EXPLANATION without skipping steps  teachers will be out of jobs, which sucks, but hey...   2010 ...  cashiers are out of jobs as well  E-Education > Class Education
